timeline.message:
JLanguageTool: cache active rules

to avoid calling `ignoreRule` for each rule in each `check` invocation, often for each sentence
and to avoid filtering out picky rules by tag on each `check` call

timeline.bodyText: This method is unused in LT, so I can remove it instead of changing. Not sure if there are external callers though.

replies.bodyText: As LT can be used from Java directly via its API, we should expect public methods to be used. We can clean them up, but for that, we should first deprecate them and only remove them 2 releases later or so.
